title: Al Alper addresses insurance executives at I-Club on technology use in insurance industry
text:

Absolute Logic CEO Al Alper selected as key speaker at I-club of Buffalo; technology presentation addresses issues, challenges facing industry
WILTON, CT and BUFFALO, NY -- Al Alper, Chief Executive Officer and founder of Absolute Logic (www.absolutelogic.com), addressed key technological/IT issues facing the insurance industry, at the recent Buffalo (NY) I-Day, which is the largest one-day insurance convention in the United States.
Alper’s presentation, “Tech Tools and How to Use Them Safely” afforded the opportunity for hundreds of insurance executives from across the region to earn Continuing Education credits, used toward the maintenance and upgrade of their professional credentials. Buffalo I-Day draws more than 1300 insurance professionals.
“Tech Tools and How to Use Them Safely” provided critical educational information relative to the insurance industry, including evaluating the effectiveness of a firewall, virtual private networks, strategies for intrusion prevention, mobile device management, and backup, disaster recovery and business continuity.
Alper, whose firm’s client list includes a significant number of insurance industry clients, said that it is more critical than ever for the insurance industry to be vigilant where their website and infrastructure is concerned. “Because the insurance industry by its nature carries sensitive and confidential information about its clients, it is imperative for each agency and practice to be certain that information is protected.”
About The Insurance Club of Buffalo
The Insurance Club of Buffalo has promoted education and fellowship in the Western New York insurance community since 1953. The Insurance Club of Buffalo organizes Buffalo I-Day, the largest one day insurance convention in the country and a summer golf outing. To learn more about the organization, please visit www.insclubbuffalo.com.
About Absolute Logic
Since 1991, Absolute Logic has been providing Fortune 500-style technical support and technology consulting to businesses of up to 250 employees. The firm’s original client base was comprised largely of independent insurance agencies, law firms and dental practices; today, these industries remain a key part of the company’s clientele but Absolute Logic has expanded its scope of services to represent more than 40 different industries. Services include managed IT services and consulting, cloud computing, virtualization, email and spam protection, backup and disaster recovery, VoIP solutions, network security, and more. Absolute Logic serves the IT and related needs of Connecticut and New York. Founder and CEO Al Alper is a national speaker on IT and security issues and has authored an article, “21 questions you should ask before seeking a computer support company.” To obtain a copy, or to request Al Alper as a speaker for a business organization, please call (203) 936-6680. Absolute Logic maintains offices at 44 Old Ridgefield Road, Suite 216, Wilton, CT, has a satellite location in Buffalo, NY and plans to open additional offices in the near future. Please visit the firm’s website at www.absolutelogic.com, and follow the company on Facebook and Twitter.
